author: José de Córdoba
title: Nicaragua Protesters Clash With Police - WSJ
text:
Protests raged Saturday in Nicaragua, where at least 10 people have been killed during four days of clashes between police and demonstrators angry about social security tax increases pushed through by President Daniel Ortega.
Television footage showed protesters in the capital of Managua blocking streets and setting tires on fire as riot police confronted them with tear gas and rubber bullets. Demonstrators also knocked down “Trees of Life”—tall metal sculptures along the city’s boulevards that light up at night, which were...
